texture: Sandy loam, Loam, Clay loam, Clay and Sandy soil
crop: Main crops are wheat, peanut, fodders, gram, maize, millets, pulses and corn
reference: Muhammad, Y., et al., soil characteristics in Attock district. Soil and Environment, 2019. 38(2): p. 241  245.

texture: Sandy loam, Silt loam and loam
crop: Main crops are Wheat, Mustard, Grains, Seasame, Peanuts and Tara mira

crop: Wheat, Pulses (Mong, Mash, Lentil and Gram), Maize, Bajara, Jawar
reference: contributors, W., Jhelum District --- {Wikipedia}{,} The Free Encyclopedia. 2022.

texture: Sandy loam, Sandy Clay Loam, Loam and Clay Loam
crop: Wheat, barley, corn (maize), and millet

crop: Potato, tomato, sugarcane, cotton, wheat, rice, and maize

texture: Silty Soil, Saline Soil, Clayey Soil
crop: Major crops of the district are sugarcane, maize, wheat, rice, cotton, bajra, moong, maash, masoor, gram, jowar, oil seeds (such as rapeseed & mustard), barley, groundnut, sesanum, sugarbeet, guarseed, linseed, sunflower, and sunn hemp
reference: Arifa, Z., et al., Evaluation of ecological aspects of natural vegetation of Pakpattan District using multivariate techniques. Journal of Biodiversity and Environmental Sciences (JBES), 2014. 5(4): p. 230-238.

crop: Wheat, corn, cotton, fodder, potato, rice , vegetables and fruits including citrus, mango, guava, dates lemon, orange and mulberry
reference: Jamil, M., et al., Indexing of physico-chemical variables and fertility status of district Sahiwal soils, Punjab, Pakistan. Soil & Environment, 2021. 40(1).

crop: Wheat, gram, cotton, sugarcane, and dates
reference: Punjab, G.o.t., Geographic Conditions. Bahawalpur Division, 2023.

crop: Sugarcane, cotton, wheat, rice and rape/mustard, bajra, moong, maash, masoor, jowar, sunflower, maize, groundnut, sesanum, sugar beet, guar seed, linseed, sunn hemp, and castor seed

texture: Sandy Clay, Clay Loam, Sandy Loam and Loam
crop: cotton, sugarcane, and wheat. Rice, maize, tobacco, bajra, moong, maash, masoor and oilseeds such as rape/ mustard and sunflower are also grown in minor quantities in the district
reference: Aamer, M., et al., Physico-chemical properties and fertility status of District Rahim Yar Khan, Pakistan. J Environ Earth Sci, 2015. 5(19): p. 11-16.
